entities.name: professor trelawney
entities.description: Professor Trelawney is mentioned as a teacher who gave a dewy smile and spoke about the Signs. She has an Inner Eye that can be a burden.

entities.name: miss granger
entities.description: Miss Granger is mentioned as someone who would be leaving, according to Professor Trelawney's prediction.

entities.name: lavender
entities.description: Lavender is mentioned as one of the students who looked deeply impressed by Professor Trelawney's words.

entities.name: parvati
entities.description: Parvati is mentioned as another student who looked deeply impressed by Professor Trelawney's words.

entities.name: ron weasley
entities.description: Ron Weasley is mentioned as someone who muttered to Harry about Hermione's future.

entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: Harry Potter is mentioned as the one Ron was talking to and also looked into the crystal ball.

entities.name: hermione granger
entities.description: Hermione Granger is mentioned as someone who would be having something in the future, according to Ron's speculation.

entities.name: neville longbottom
entities.description: Neville Longbottom is mentioned as a student who seemed close to a nervous collapse due to excessive homework.

entities.name: seamus finnigan
entities.description: Seamus Finnigan is mentioned as someone who complained about the lack of relaxation during the Easter holidays.

relationships.description: Professor Trelawney predicted that Miss Granger would be leaving, according to the text.
Ron speculated about Hermione's future, and Harry seemed to be aware of it, as mentioned in the text.
Professor Trelawney's words impressed Lavender and Parvati, according to the text.
